content.text: Work out how many more students choose biology than physics
Write down the fraction of students whose favourite science subject is chemistry
One of the 20 students is picked at random
Write down the probability that this student did **not** choose biology
Write down the average that can be found
Find this average for these results
Explain why the range cannot be found
Only **one** of the averages, median, mode and mean can be found for these results
Complete the table
Complete the pie chart
The results are to be shown in a pie chart
20 students choose their favourite science subject
The results are shown in the bar chart
The hotel has 840 rooms
735 rooms are occupied
Calculate the percentage of rooms that are occupied
The temperature in the hotel is \(21^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\)
The temperature in the hotel is \(26.7^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\) warmer than at the top of the mountain
The temperature at the top of the mountain is \(3.2^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\) colder than at the bottom of the mountain
Work out the temperature at the bottom of the mountain

content.text: There are two adults and one child in the family
They hire all their equipment
The child skis for 3 days and snowboards for 4 days
Both adults ski for 7 days
All three of them hire a helmet for 7 days
Work out the total cost of the equipment hire for the family
A ski lift, when full, takes 4000 passengers per hour
This lift works for 10 hours a day
One day, this lift is \(90\%\) full for 3 hours and \(75\%\) full for 7 hours
Work out the number of passengers who take the lift that day
The family buy their lift passes before the holiday for a total of 51 400 rupees
In America, the passes cost a total of \(\)684
The exchange rate is 1 rupee \(=\) \(\)0.0129\$
Show that the family save 1620 rupees, correct to the nearest 10 rupees, by buying the passes before their holiday
The height, \(h\) metres, of the mountain is \(2642 \text{m}\), correct to the nearest metre
Complete this statement about the value of \(h\)
A family go on a skiing holiday to America
Measure angle \(w\)

triangle \(A\) onto triangle \(B\),
triangle \(B\) onto triangle \(C\)

The actual distance between \(K\) and \(L\) is 9600 metres

Each bunch has 5 flowers
The price of one bunch of flowers is \(\$ 2.68\)

15 of the flowers are red
18 of the flowers are orange
The rest of the flowers are yellow
Write down the ratio of the number of red flowers : orange flowers : yellow flowers
Give your answer in its simplest form
Use this information to show that \(5x - 10 = 45\)
Solve the equation \(5x - 10 = 45\)

Prakash gives the 45 flowers to his family
He gives his grandmother \(x\) flowers
He gives his mother 8 more flowers than his grandmother
He gives his cousin 6 fewer flowers than his grandmother
He gives his sister twice as many flowers as he gives his cousin
Prakash buys 45 flowers from a shop

The cakes take 20 minutes to bake

Give your answer in kilograms

The baker sells each cake for 65 cents
